title: Oxfordshire Live: Friday 16 September - BBC News
summary: no trains from didcot parkway due to flooding .
maternity ward in wallingford and three didcot schools closed due to floods .
boy in bicester robbed of bike at knifepoint .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: our clothes are a little drier , the sky 's a little bluer , and it 's time to wind up bbc local live for oxfordshire for another day .
our service resumes at 08:00 on monday - join us then .

documents.title: travel updates : slow traffic across county
text: there 's slow traffic on the a40 westbound in asthall between the b4047 burford road junction and the a361 high street junction in the roadworks area .
one lane is blocked and there 's very slow traffic on the a34 northbound between the milton interchange in milton and marcham interchange in shippon , because of a broken down vehicle .
the a40 in eynsham is partially blocked and there 's queuing traffic eastbound at the cuckoo lane junction , because of an accident involving two cars .
and traffic is heavier than usual traffic on the a40 southbound between thame in milton common and stokenchurch .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: stabbing in headington
text: a man was stabbed in headington yesterday .
thames valley police was called to margaret road at the junction of st anne 's road at about 15:47 .
a 48-year-old man was taken to hospital and is in a stable condition .

det inspector jim holmes said : `` we are appealing to anyone who may have seen this assault to come forward at this time we do not believe this was a random attack and do not believe there is a danger to the wider public .
`` we have increased patrols in the area and anyone with concerns should speak to the neighbourhood policing team . ''

documents.title: heathrow/oxford bus cancellations
text: due to operational reasons , the following services will not operate : lhr - 1700 oxford to heathrow oxf - 1850 heathrow to oxford

documents.title: banbury man wanted by police
text: police are trying to trace a man wanted on recall to prison .
david french , 32 , was last seen on 15 july in edmonds road , banbury .
he is described as white , 5ft 10ins , of broad build with cropped brown hair , with a birthmark on the left side of his neck .

det sgt lee newman , from banbury police station , said : `` we would still like to hear from anyone who recognises david or knows of his whereabouts and ask them not to approach him but to contact police as a matter of urgency .
`` he is known to frequent the banbury area and also has links to basingstoke so i would also appeal to anyone in hampshire to report any possible sightings of david . ''

documents.title: south weather
text: south weather

documents.title: breakingea : 'possible flooding still to come '
text: the environment agency has given its flood risk forecast for the next three days , but it 's areas further east that are likely to be affected .
`` during friday afternoon and into the early evening areas of heavy thundery rain will move eastwards affecting parts of the south and east of england .

`` this could lead to surface water flooding impacts , especially in urban areas , such as flooding on the road and rail network leading to significant travel delays , and possibly the flooding of properties and parts of communities .
`` on saturday afternoon in the far south-east of england further heavy showers may develop , leading to some localised travel disruption and possibly some property flooding . ''

documents.title: calm after the storm
text: oxon firefighters no longer in attendance at any flooding incidents .
no met office rain alerts in force for oxon .

documents.title: in storms across the east and south of england
text: news online has collated the most impressive of the last 12 hours , which has seen severe disruption and flooding throughout the east and south of england .
you can view them here .

documents.title: tree fall causes delays between leamington spa and banbury
text: a tree on the line between leamington spa and banbury is causing disruption , network rail has warned .
a spokesman said trains were being delayed by up to 30 minutes .
he added : `` trains will be unable to run from banbury towards leamington spa until the tree has been removed .
`` disruption is expected to continue until 16:00 . ''

documents.title: water erupts on didcot road
text: workers at didcot parkway have probably seen enough water for one day , but had to scramble into action when a pump got dislodged , sending water spurting high into the air .

documents.title: platforms open at didcot parkway
text: there 's still a flurry of activity at didcot parkway but we 've informed that platforms there are now open .

documents.title: didcot parkway flooding : clean-up begins
text: didcot parkway flooding : clean-up begins

documents.title: oxford bus company x90 service experiencing delays
text: we are currently still experiencing delays on our x90 services from this morning 's disruption .
we are trying to operate our services as regular as possible but please expect delays this afternoon in both directions .
thank you !

documents.title: commuters offered alternative routes following floods
text: david martin , station manager at didcot , has been discussing the arrangements made for commuters following heavy flooding at the site .

documents.title: oxfordshire 's big picture
text: have a look at our readers ' snaps from the last week .

documents.title: bicester boy robbed by man with knife
text: a 16-year-old boy had his mountain bike robbed at knifepoint in bicester .
it took place at about 22:00 on thursday 8 september on the playing fields behind bicester leisure centre .
the man is described as black , of a slim build , about 6ft tall and wearing a black hooded top .
he also stole a rucksack .
police said it was a red and black specialised p1 mountain bike that was taken , with chunky tyres and black central hubs .

documents.title: post-heatwave storm brings flash floods
text: in didcot , the station is closed , as well as three schools .

documents.title: didcot parkway ticket office to stay closed 'for some time '
text: pumps are being used at didcot parkway in a bid to remove floodwater and get the station 's platforms open `` as soon as possible '' , a spokesman said .
but he added that because of damage the ticket office is likely to stay closed `` for some time '' .

documents.title: three didcot schools closed due to flooding
text: three didcot schools have confirmed they are closed today after the flooding this morning .
they are :

documents.title: flooding closes wallingford community hospital maternity unit
text: oxford university hospitals nhs foundation trust said it has closed the midwifery-led unit at wallingford community hospital because of flooding .
a spokeswoman said : `` we have temporarily closed this unit whilst we undertake emergency checks of our facilities there to see whether they are all safe to use .
`` we will issue a further update later today after these checks have been carried out .
no women were in the unit at the time .
`` any woman who was planning on delivering at wallingford who goes into labour today will be offered the option of a home birth or the wantage midwifery-led unit as another option . ''

documents.title: preparations for the post-flood clean-up have started
text: our street cleaning crews are on standby to go round and clear up all the affected areas as soon as the flood water has drained away .
our waste crews are working around the floods in didcot .
any bins not emptied today will be emptied tomorrow if possible - if not , monday .
no doubt some people will moan if their bins do n't get emptied !
honestly

text: firetruck pumps clearing water at flooded didcot parkway station , oxfordshire

documents.title: no more weather warnings in oxfordshire
text: the good news is that oxon is no longer under a yellow or amber alert for rain .
# thunderstorms

documents.title: bus delays in oxford due to flooding
text: due to weather and traffic conditions in and around oxford , some of our local services are experiencing delays of up to 30 minutes .
however , all routes are being served at the moment .
thank you for your patience during these difficult conditions .

documents.title: royal county of berkshire show to go ahead
text: a spokesman for the royal county of berkshire show said it is still going ahead tomorrow despite the severe weather in newbury , where the show is held .

documents.title: uk thunderstorms : what to expect today
text: uk thunderstorms : what to expect today

documents.title: oxford travel update : all the same issues , and more
text: trains and roads across the county have been severely affected by flooding last night .
here are some additional reports that have just come in :
author: Al Ryan
BBC Oxford travel presenter

documents.title: firefighters tackling flooding across oxfordshire
text: oxfordshire county council 's fire and rescue service has dealt with a spate of calls since 04:00 linked to the heavy rain overnight .
areas affected by flash flooding include didcot , goring , wallingford , cholsey , south stoke and east hagbourne .
firefighters attended wallingford community hospital where some parts of the buildings were affected by flooding .
they have also been working to protect some properties from waters on station road in cholsey .
group manager gary coupar said : `` we 've had to deal with a number of instances of cars becoming stranded as a result of trying to drive through floodwater .
people should avoid doing this .
if the electrics in your home are being affected by floodwater please turn off the electricity ''

documents.title: bus replacements running at didcot parkway
text: # didcotparkway flooded .
trains diverted .
local buses from short-stay .
one rail-replacement , more ordered .

documents.title: houses flooded in didcot
text: kim in didcot says her mum 's house in bridge close , didcot , has been flooded and the whole downstairs is ruined .
she said : `` people are trapped in their houses .
no one is doing anything . ''

documents.title: didcot school cut off
text: all saints primary school in didcot is cut off by flood water , and so is currently closed .
a decision whether to open the school will be made at 11:00 , its headmaster , john myers told us .
parents are asked to check the school website then for an update .

documents.title: didcot station an 'absolute nightmare '
text: a spokesman for didcot parkway has urged people to check gwr 's website before they travel because access to the platforms is completely blocked .
he said trains are still able to arrive so passengers are being diverted via swindon and added that at present the situation is an `` absolute nightmare '' .

documents.title: man stabbed in headington
text: thames valley police was called to margaret road , headington , oxford , yesterday at 15:47 to reports a man had been stabbed .
an ambulance attended and took one man to hospital , where he is in a stable condition .
no arrests have been made .

documents.title: breakingflood alert issued for steventon and sutton courtney
text: the environment agency has issued a flood alert for the ginge brook , which affects the steventon area down to and including sutton courtenay .
the agency warns low lying land and roads will be affected first and a spokesman said people should `` be prepared '' .

documents.title: highways england attempting to clear flooding on m4
text: we 're continuing work to clear flooding # m4 w/b at j8 # maidenhead .
2 lanes remain closed on the main c/way and the w/b entry slip is closed .

documents.title: fire service at wallingford community hospital
text: a caller into bbc oxford has said fire crews have had to be called to the maternity unit at wallingford community hospital due to flooding .
the hospital has refused to comment .

documents.title: flood alert in pangbourne on river thames
text: the environment agency has issued a flood alert for the thames from days lock to above pangbourne in oxfordshire .
flooding is possible around dorchester , overy , shillingford , benson , wallingford , winterbrook , east hagbounre , south moreton , mouslford , south stoke , goring and streatley .
property flooding is not expected .
flood alert , 7:21am 16/09/2016 , river thames & its tributaries from days l , # floodaware

documents.title: police warn drivers about weather disruption
text: severe disruption to roads throughout the thames valley today due to flooding .
please drive carefully # tvpfloods

documents.title: travel update oxford : torrential rain causing major disruption
text: torrential rain is causing major disruption across the county 's roads , there 's a lot of standing water so do take care .
here 's our latest updates :
author: Al Ryan
BBC Oxford travel presenter

documents.title: no services running from didcot to london
text: great western railway has said the flooded subway at didcot parkway means no services are currently running to london .
there is no estimate for when normal service will resume at the moment .
flooding is causing disruption at newbury & didcot parkway .
newbury ( delays of up to 30 mins ) .
didcot ( cancellations towards london/oxford )
services are unable to call at newbury because of flooding at the station .
services will call additionally at newbury racecourse .
if travelling from didcot parkway towards reading/london paddington , you will need to travel via swindon .
flooding is causing disruption at newbury & didcot parkway .
newbury ( no service - use racecourse ) .
didcot ( cancellations to london/oxford ) .
services towards reading & london are now able to call at newbury .
services west of newbury will continue to use newbury racecourse .
services towards reading/london & oxford are unable to call at didcot parkway .
limited road transport is available between didcot & cholsey .
didcot parkway station has now reopened after earlier flooding of the subway .
apologies for disruption today .
does this mean eastbound services are calling at didcot ( where timetabled ) rather than going to reading and back ?
thanks : )
hello charlie , yes didcot is fully open but delays and cancellations because of signalling issues at paddington .
-andy
how about the journey back from london to didcot later this evening ?
assume trains are calling at platform 1 as usual
hi dave .
platform 1 is open .
-ollie
any idea when did will reopen ?
no estimate for normal service to resume .
didcot open for services towards swindon .
-ollie
should be clear that bristol , bath , chippenham and swindon are also badly impacted .
i could have driven and been there by now .
